p: The whole plant (flower, stems and leaves) of W. glabra was collected from the Gangs Rinpoche Mountain at an altitude of 5200 m, Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau, China at the end of August 2013, and identified by Prof. Peng-Cheng Lin (Qinghai Nationalities University, Xining, China). A voucher specimen (DJGb-2013730) was deposited in the Herbarium of Biodiversity Science and Geobiology of Tibet University.
